result_list.explanation: This stage direction describes the setting of the scene, indicating it represents the Palace of Omphale.
result_list.stgdir: Le Théâtre représente le Palais d'Omphale.

result_list.explanation: This stage direction indicates the addressee of a speech, directing the character to address Oronte.
This stage direction describes a musical piece, starting with 'Air' and specifying the tune name.
result_list.stgdir: Air : D'Églé. Que je vous aime !

result_list.explanation: This stage direction describes the entrance of nine chorists onto the stage.
result_list.stgdir: ANNA et EUGÉNIE écoutent chanter. Vers la fin du morceau, neuf choristes arrivent sur la scène, à la suite de leur maîtresse de choeur.

result_list.explanation: This stage direction describes the entrance of the character Amintus.
This stage direction describes a non-verbal interaction where one character is scattering rose petals over another's head.
result_list.stgdir: Lui effeuillant son bouquet de roses sur la tête.

result_list.explanation: This stage direction describes Julie opening a letter and being observed by her father and Molière, indicating interaction with an object.
result_list.stgdir: Julie ouvre la lettre. Son père et Molière l'observent.

result_list.explanation: This stage direction describes the character repeating four verses, which is a delivery manner related to vocal expression.
This stage direction describes the entrance of two small boys and a small girl.
result_list.stgdir: Entrée de deux petits paysans et d'une petite paysanne.

result_list.explanation: This stage direction describes the character exiting the stage with the demi-gods.
result_list.stgdir: Il s'en va avec les demi-Dieux.
